website_summaries.verdict: This pack has the advantage of front pockets, making your personal gear easier to access while out for a run.
pros: Front pockets have designated spaces for cell phone, keys, ID, and water bottle
It has reflective strips on both the front and the back
Elastic helps keep your water bottle from bouncing
The vest is very adjustable, allowing you to get the right fit
cons: This model has space for a water bladder, but does not come with one

customer_reviews.title: Best vest and best value
customer_reviews.text: Where do I start? This vest is amazing!! For starters it’s very light and comfortable and doesn’t bounce even when you have the bladder full. This vest has plenty of storage I had two bottles, bladder, keys and found a bonus pocket for my iPhone8 and in this pocket the phone stayed dry when my vest was wet! There is still extra storage for gel packets, salt tablets or whatever, and in with the bladder there is storage also if needed . I would recommend this for all distance runners that are looking to stay hydrated, or light runs when needing to carry items. Would definitely purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Superb Choice for Serious Trail Running
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I needed for medium-long distance (10–30 miles) trail running. I bought and sent back a couple of options before finding this. The sheer adjustability of this vest is awesome. I'm big but lean—230 pounds of muscle—which means I have some interesting contours to work with, and I can get this to fit perfectly. My iPhone 8+ in an Otterbox Defender fits in one of the front pockets (it sticks out, but it's not going anywhere) and there's ample room upfront for another bottle (with a hand strap), my wallet, keys, and other small items. The rear storage is big enough for a backup bottle, headlamp, and a buff. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Asha EmberTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I love this vest for my longer runs. It came with 2 small water bottles that you can run with in the front bottom pockets. There is also a small zipper on the top right that I put my energy chews in. I have also purchased a 1 lt. bladder that I put in the back which is great when I don't want to take the water bottles. Lately I run with one water bottle in one pocket and my cell in the other. It's quite small and compact. The quality is great and the price is very reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Pew

customer_reviews.title: Perfect on those trails and the AZ heat!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my Nathan water backpack. It has been FABULOUS...literally there is no difference in comfort or quality! Ive been training with it for my 25k trail race yesterday, since July, in the high heat of AZ... I wear this every run so it's being used 3-4x a week. Never have any chafing issues. Ive washed it a couple times. Got a bunch of my trail troop to buy it as well...HIGHLY recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Pixie-08

customer_reviews.title: Cost: $38 -- Value:
customer_reviews.text: Comfort is ridiculous. No shirt no problem; if it starts moving just tighten the straps at the same time. There is a second blue-zipper pocket underneath the yellow-zipper pocket. Plus another pocket (Velcro) on your right upper chest where the nearly weightless whistle is attached. There's a surprisingly large storage compartment beside the internal mesh bladder compartment. Doesn't ride neck. The bottles aren't the softest out there, but have a canoed fuller on the flat side to naturally ride your Infrasternal Angle (I looked that up, I think that's the spot). Dunno how they managed to perfectly fit my lats--along with everything else--with these side straps but they did.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Too Bouncy Using the Hydration Bladder
customer_reviews.text: I specifically wanted to use this vest for running with a hydration bladder. I used one that I have, a CamelBak 1.5-liter bladder, which fits perfectly in the hydration bladder pocket. However, it's way too bouncy to run with until there isn't much water left. I even tried packing the pocket with towels to reduce the bounce but to no avail. The vest might be okay running with only bottles in the front pockets, but that's not what I need it for. It just doesn't work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Susan

customer_reviews.title: Best for hikes, love this vest.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome awesome awesome!!!! This is the best vest for exercise. I primarily use it for hikes. There’s several pockets I can fit my car keys, pocket knife, selfie stick, portable music speaker, water pouches and sunscreen. Before I used a backpack which always felt heavy on my back but with this I feel so lightweight and not dragged down by what feels like extra weight. Straps are easy to tighten. My chest is 43 inches and this is a bit snug for the larger size but the top strap is stretchy which helps it fit perfect. For running I just tighten the straps a bit more for more durability. Highly recommend for those always outside in the outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Christy Schoeller

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for marathon training at an unbeatable price!
customer_reviews.text: I have now run several 6-8 mile runs, and the vest is perfect. My favorite features: 1. I’m 5’2” and wear a DD running bra. It’s very adjustable, and the pockets are slightly to the side (not right on the front of your breasts). Therefore, it’s extremely comfortable! 2. Even when the hydration pack is full of water, I can still pack gels, nasal spray, an inhaler, tissue, gum, a key, and more in the pockets. 3. It doesn’t move when you run. 4. It does’t cause shoulder and neck pain that I usually get from running vests. 5. It’s a quality vest that doesn’t feel cheaply made. 6. The color is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Kerri

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great find!
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight! Great for running! I love how snug it is and doesn’t rub anywhere when wearing and running. There was no bouncing or unnecessary movement. It did not come with a bladder, but I had one from a hydration backpack that I HATED! It fit perfectly in this vest. I highly recommend! Price was great and the product is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.  This is a must have.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. Great for long runs. I have been looking for a while for a good running vest but not wanting to spend all my money on one. This is the perfect size, fit and cost. Good quality plus the sliding straps make the fit superb. It doesn't move on your long runs and the bottles are easy in and out. The pocket in the back can be used for a bladder or to hold more items. Plus there is a pocket on the front that stretches out for a phone or other running essentialshoes. Buy with confidence!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jermaine Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great Running Hydration Pack - zero rubbing
customer_reviews.text: Did several 4 and 5 mile runs to test it. Had zero issues. Took it on a 12 mile run and again had zero blisters or hotspots. Had 1.8 liters in the bladder and a full bottle in the front pocket. Very little bounce. Once i figured out how to secure the hose to stop bouncing against my bottle it was a great fit and run. Only inconvenience I've encountered is the slightly small front bottle pockets/pouches. Just a tad too tight to fit a hand bottle (oval/oblong shape) in the pocket so I had to buy new round bottles to fit the pockets. I'll update periodically to discuss durability. But so far, great product and would absolutely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Hollenbeck

customer_reviews.title: SELLER DOES NOT RESPECT WARRANTY OR FIX DEFECTS
customer_reviews.text: I bought this backpack with the bladder in March and have been using the two bottles and backpack until now. Two weeks ago I opened the bladder to find out it leaks water everywhere and is essentially useless. Seller would not honor they're so called 18 month warranty. Would avoid and purchase from these folks instead:
customer_reviews.author: MeepDeep

customer_reviews.title: Good design and build
customer_reviews.text: - Helped on long runs for marathon training. I carry 40oz of water, phone, hat and energy; about 3 lbs. - Managers and distributes the load weight well; its not so noticeable while running. 6x adjustable straps secure the load IMO better then hydration belts. - Pockets on shoulder straps nice for storing/accessing energy chews etc. without removing the pack. - good design: adjustable and plenty of useful storage. Also its got decent construction quality. - front pockets works well with 20oz "standard" disposable water bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Hydration Pack
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I needed to store all of the things I don't want to carry in my hands. Water is easy to access for cleaning, filling, and drinking. Lots of little pockets for small things, and the front two pouches can hold a phone pretty securely (I have Otter Box for grip). Word of advise, don't make the mistake I did by putting the electrolyte tablets in the bladder and not clean it right away. Have a bad taste now in the bladder because the tablets went sour in the bladder.
customer_reviews.author: Walt

customer_reviews.title: The perfect hydration pack
customer_reviews.text: I stumbled across this TRIWONDER hydration pack when I was searching for a camel pack to support my hiking, biking, and endurance running. It saved my life when I made a terrible decision to ride 100-miles straight! I love the way the top folds over and seals after you fill it up and the non-leak nozzle on the end. I was also able to stuff some protein bars, my iphone and charger, and my Airpods in the pockets. This packet is definitely lightweight, comfortable, and breathes well. I am glad i purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: David N.

customer_reviews.title: Small Woman and it Fits
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these. One for my husband and myself. I am worried because cinched up works great for me however my husband is 6 ft big chest. His is for upcoming birthday. I will know soon enough if one size does fit all. I am only 5 ft and I love it. I just wish the iPhone 6s Plus would fit in the front pocket. I have to carry it in the rear. It is okay since I have an Apple watch. Great color with reflective areas and plenty of storage for me. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Everything I wanted with a better price
customer_reviews.text: Great fit for the long run and ride. I wanted to make sure I had a few workouts in before posting. After a 62 mile bike ride and a 15 mile run in 80 degree weather I am loving this vest. I was worried it would trap too much heat on my back but it didn’t. The back pocket is roomy and keeps my fuel and cell phone sweat-free. I was also worried about the fit in the front, being a DD gal. The water bottles are well positioned and I had no issues with bounce.
customer_reviews.author: Stacia Reagan

customer_reviews.title: Best Yet
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased a number of running cargo packs and this is far and away the best one i've purchased. It's the first one that does NOT stress my rotator cuff. It does not shif around. I'm able to access ALL my liquid sources (front and back) without pulling things out of pockets. There is room for freaking EVERYTHING you could possibly need of a 20 mile training run. All pockets are immediately available while in motion. Great price!! Shipped quickly!! Ridiculously easy to adjust. I'm trying to think of one thing negative to say about this product....... Nope I've got nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Moon

customer_reviews.title: Pics are misleading
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after reviewing the pics and the very first review pics which are misleading. This vest DOES NOT COME WITH A WATER BLADDER, First review shows pics of the vest with the bladder. Product pics show bladder pocket making me think it came with one. Now I have to order a water bladder for $20 plus dollars and wait another 2 weeks for delivery. I am sending it back and ordering one with bladder. I would have preferred to spend a little more money and got the bladder with it. Other than that...I like the vest and would have given 5 stars if it had come with the bladder and not have misleading photos.
customer_reviews.author: kimberly Jones

customer_reviews.title: Outdoors junkie
customer_reviews.text: I am not a runner, but I am an outdoors junkie, I hike, kayak, skii, bike, swim in wild water, camp, etc. This is one of the most convinient items I have. My hands are free but all my essentials are within reach. I don't need to worry about removing my backpack back and forth to take out my things. During my last kayak trip, I was happy to be hands free to drink water and continue to paddle without interruption. I have only had this vest for a little bit of time, I will update this review later on to ellaborate on endurance.
customer_reviews.author: Ella K.

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, plenty of pockets and whistle
customer_reviews.text: Update 2/18/20: received replacement bladder last week. Works perfect. Great service. 👍🏽 Update 1/30/20: as suggested by seller, contact via order details page. However, there is no option on the phone app. I will try on my computer when I have access to one. It would have been perfect had it not been for the leaking bladder. It fits great, lightweight, super adjustable and pockets for everything. How do I get a replacement bladder?
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: Good vest for the price.  Bladder is weak.
customer_reviews.text: The vest fits well, does not chafe during 3-4 hour run. Comfortable material. The zipper is a bit flimsy, I'm not sure it will last - but the front pockets are roomy and secure. Lots of space for iphone 6, gels, key fob. The bladder is very disappointing, it started leaking as soon as I filled it. *** Update - customer service was great about refunding the amount it takes to purchase a replacement bladder. Would buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Shop1

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Hydration Vest for Fraction of Price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for myself and my partner. Were both very pleased with this hydration vest. It has lots of pockets,very comfortable for running doesnt move around. The water pack holds a lot of water. We went for 10 mile walk/run the vest was amazing for what we need pockets for keys, cellphone, even comes with a small whistle, we love the little details of this vest. Highly recommend to our friends.
customer_reviews.author: Angie Chua

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: I love this little back pack. the bladder worked well and I appreciate the pockets etc. The reason why I cannot give 5 stars is the water coming from the bladder tastes like plastic. Even though I cleaned it multiple times. I hope the taste goes away but that is my biggest complaint. Otherwise I love this vest/backpack because it is versatile and can be used without the bladder.
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this pack few times and on the last run one of the zippers broke. Pretty disappointing for something only used a few times. Edit, dropping the score. On this packs 5th or so use it broke completely. While the front zipper pocket breaking wasn’t a big deal, the other day the side strap completely frayed and came off the pack. This made the pack completely useless. The left side just hangs on my shoulder with no support. I wouldn’t buy this again or recommend anyone to buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica B.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I’m a very petite woman, who hasn’t had any luck with any running belts that’s hold water. They always stretch out. I LOVE this vest. Great for the price. I am flat chested so I have to completely tighten the front but the sides still give me room to make it smaller if it ever stretches. I’ve run 12 miles at one time, in a sports bra, in the heat and it didn’t chafe at all.
customer_reviews.author: Minnie

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this vest. I'm a 5'3" woman and it adjusted very well to my slender frame, and is very light. It's cut short like I wanted, and stops just about at the bottom of my rib cage. Multiple pockets in many places. Holds a 1.5 (or 2.0?) bladder. It is very comfortable and breathable on my back under the bladder. My only issue is the water tube holder. It is stationary, and I wish it could be clipped on and off to accommodate the location of the mouthpiece to my own convenience.
customer_reviews.author: TRIMom

customer_reviews.title: Versatile pack for long-distance runners
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the version with two bottles. I found the construction to be solid and the sizing to be flexible. The larger front pockets fit the water bottles with ease. The smaller pockets above are a bit on the small side but are large enough for a small amount of food or keys. The rear pocket is large and can fit a bladder or other supplies easily. The pack is lightweight and feels good on the body. I'm happy with the purchase and will consider adding the bladder in the future for my marathon training.
customer_reviews.author: G P

customer_reviews.title: Very soft fabric lots of storage
customer_reviews.text: I had to send this one back because of a funny taste in the bladder that I couldn’t get out. BUT...it was a really nice hydration vest. Really soft and never chafed anywhere. Lots of storage for snacks, keys and iPhone 7plus. The hose was kind of stiff bit I got used to it. I probably should have kept it and just bought a new bladder.
customer_reviews.author: Carol R

customer_reviews.title: Fits ALL Runners
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my first marathon and CANNOT wait to use it for more races!! It holds a TON of stuff, as well as my 2L bladder from my other pack. I am a plus size gal (1x tops) and it didn't bounce, or move, and FIT!!!! I recommend it to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah G.

customer_reviews.title: The two small bottles fit great (& are surprisingly good quality) or you can put ...
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed without the ridiculous price of other 'running' brands. The two small bottles fit great (& are surprisingly good quality) or you can put a 1.5l bladder in the back and use the pockets for bear spray/cell phone. Cinches up perfectly for my small frame but I'd say it's adaptable for larger frames too. Sits snug and doesn't jig around. Little zip pocket holds a few gels/gummies/tissues. So glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Parrstar

customer_reviews.title: Buy This!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot understand why people are so enamored with the UD and Nathan packs that cost 2-3 times as much. This is a great vest at a great price. All the pockets are well placed and accessible. The front water bottles do not bounce. My Samsung S7 fits perfectly (without case) in the zipper sleeve. I have been using it for a few months on runs and hikes and it has held up perfectly. I would absolutely buy this again and recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: sunshine

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE ITEM, DEFECTIVE & LEAKY😰😰😰
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item and expected it to work well👎🏼, it leak the first day.. i was so aggravated that it almost ruined my run🤷🏽‍♂️ But i made it through, i’m definitely returning this item and going with a different company, along with letting all of my run teams to stay away🤔🤔
customer_reviews.author: A WISE FAMILY SHOPPER

customer_reviews.title: High quality at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this purchase. Liked that I could buy without the bladder or other hydration packs (since I have them already). It’s a good solid fit for running. High quality construction and materials at a fair price. Zippers all work great. My iPhone8 fits well in one pocket, pack of tissues fits well in another. I was worried about not getting a female specific vest but no issues with the girls. I am a solid size 16 and I’m just shy of maxing out the straps.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Drysen

customer_reviews.title: Love this hydration vest!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use for my first marathon and I loved it! I bought the bladder with it and it's easy to use. You have to make sure the tube is fully clicked into the notch on the bladder or the liquid won't come out. It's light weight, super comfy and not restrictive at all. I've recommended it to other runners in my group and they love it as well. It's easy to clean as well. Highly recommend this vest!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Runs really small
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big guy who enjoys running long distances. I saw this and thought that its minimalist design would suit my frame. Unfortunately, even with every strap loosened all the way, I had a very hard time getting this on and off. This would be best for someone with a very slender frame.
customer_reviews.author: Sean G. Donovan

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it once so far and it was on a 16 mile trail run. It was very comfortable. Did not bounce at all and stayed very snug. The bottles were good and I was even able to put my phone behind one of them in the strap pocket. I was able to carry enough snacks and an extra bottle of water in the pack along with extra items. I plan to get a 2 liter hydration bladder at some point and I'm sure it will do just fine. I will be using it on bike rides as well this Summer.
customer_reviews.author: Rockerdude004

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Bought for marathon training in the summer. Light but durable. Fit 3 -16-24oz waters along with a few bandanas and odds and ends. The only skin issues was when I wore it wearing only a sports bra underneath - the bottom of the back chafed my back, but that would probably happen with any pack. The clips were sturdy and the two tiny strap pockets were perfect for mace and a pocket knife.
customer_reviews.author: EKK

customer_reviews.title: Beats the more expensive brands - perfect for hiking!
customer_reviews.text: Love the price - could not justify paying REI prices for the same type vest. Holds my smart water bottles along with other electrolytes sport bottles - I use one pocket to carry my drink and the other to hold my keys. I find the back pocket the perfect size for snacks and lightweight jacket for my short 3-5 mile hiking trips.
customer_reviews.author: LadyDiTech

customer_reviews.title: Love this hydration pack for my longer runs
customer_reviews.text: Love this hydration pack for my longer runs, no bouncing at all! This is my first hydration pack and I was pleasantly surprised by how well it felt, normally I have used the waist belts and those do bounce but not this vest! I will be using it for my longer runs since it is now summer time and I will need to keep hydrated, love the extra pockets for my gu and my cell phone. Also ordered the water bottles which worked perfect for extra water!
customer_reviews.author: Flaka

customer_reviews.title: It worked for me!
customer_reviews.text: Today, I ran half a marathon and this vest kept me going with my hydration bottle and my music. The vest is light and it worked great for carrying the necessary things like car keys, liquids, phone and other things in the back like light snacks and a tissues pack. If you are into running, i recommend this vest. No more running with dry mouth or carrying bottles in my hand! Yay!!!
customer_reviews.author: GC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for long runs! No complaints!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this hydration pack specifically for the 2018 LA Marathon. I only filled up half the bladder and used the separate compartment for some snacks. I loved that it has a pocket in the front large enough for my phone which provided easy access for those moments when you want to snap a quick picture. It also fits snug which is good because I hate it when running belts ride up or slip down.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen

customer_reviews.title: Bladder Strong Plastic Smell
customer_reviews.text: I love the vest..well made, nice color, comfortable, right amount of storage. I would highly recommend buying only the best! The bladder and hose smelled so bad even after washing it and soaking it in different cleaning Products for 1.5 weeks. Still has the same strong plastic smell and taste.
customer_reviews.author: ARW

customer_reviews.title: Back area not as great
customer_reviews.text: I love all the pockets but dislike that the pocket to put things in the back is not separated from the water bladder area. Because of the water condensation, it'll make my other items wet and also against my back since it's not waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: K. Lao

customer_reviews.title: So far so good....
customer_reviews.text: Wow product has so far exceeded expectations. I’ve been using this on my weekly long runs that range from 9-15 miles and has held up nicely. Stays tight on the body and the water bottle doesn’t move around. I chose to go with the 2 water bottles and no water bladder. Able to hold enough gel packs and a phone if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for distance running
customer_reviews.text: This has worked great for me on long runs. As long as I get the air out of the bladder, I have no issues with it sloshing around on my back.
customer_reviews.author: Shifty Mcneely

customer_reviews.title: Best long distance hydration solution.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for running longer distances (greater than 10 miles)and I find it to be great. It fits well and doesn’t move around. It like the zipper compartment on the left side. It holds a wafer folded in 1/2, and an iPhone 7. The Velcro compartment on the right can hold my keys. It can hold 2 10 ounce bottles of water and 4 stinger gels easily. I have bought 2 of them.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Took the pack (Sans water bladder) for a 3 mile run. I have neck and shoulder issues and wanted to give it a spin before making it heavier. I have a large chest, and it fit well and stayed in place. My neck and shoulders feel good so far. I’ll be trying it with the water bladder soon! The pink and yellow/green are great as reflective gear for running at dusk too! Love my new tri wonder!
customer_reviews.author: Jaclyn

customer_reviews.title: Great storage but lacking in durability
customer_reviews.text: I received this hydration pack 2 months ago but did not get a chance to use it until now because of trails, social distancing, etc. However, today I was super excited to try it out on my first long run since March. Great room for my phone, keys, GUs, etc. BUT LITERALLY 30 steps into my run the piece of material that holds the front strap on/how it connects to the back to make the backpack broke!!! Thank goodness I was near my car. Sad I had to cut my run short due to lack of hydration since I could no longer carry the pack.
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: This is junk - beware of all the fake positive reviews
customer_reviews.text: This is cheap junk. It worked for a bit, then the hose stopped staying connected to the bladder. You'll be running along and go to take a sip of water, and nothing comes out. Even if you stop and take the thing apart and stick the hose back into the bladder (serious PITA if you're in a trail race), it loses its connection again within a mile or two. Hydration vest is useless and the company is unresponsive. They don't honor their warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Leafpile

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it once but still needed it when I did my 14 jogging miles and it was nice. Not heavy, secure, lite weight, and enough room to put my phone and extras in the front pockets. Enough water to last or at least me anyway. First time using a vest so I still feel kinda funny wearing one but would not go long distance with out one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable, great price
customer_reviews.text: Great product! My husband ran the 24 hour Spartan Ultra World Championship in Iceland and needed a hydration system with storage. He was able to carry extra headlamps, nutrition, emergency equipment and enough water to last him multiple laps at a time. He was very impressed that the water "bladder" didn't leak or burst as he rolled under barbed wire and put the vest through hell. We appreciated bright color options so I could tell when he was coming in the dark. The pack was comfortable for his 20 hours of straight running and easy to fill, unlike many other products. Thanks for an awesome, fairly priced, well made product!
customer_reviews.author: Keri Fox

customer_reviews.title: Great vest! Terrible bottles.
customer_reviews.text: Pack is very comfortable and doesn't move around. I was worried about it being too tight but plenty of space still and I'm a 46 sport coat. I gave it 4 stars because the bottles that shipped with it are just crap, the spigot broke on the very first use. Buy the pack, don't but the kit. Throw some Nathan or another brand bottles in there.
customer_reviews.author: Ben O.

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with this Lightweight vest.
customer_reviews.text: I love this lightweight vest. I carry 2 bottles of water and there is a small pocket for my ipod and another pocket for other essentials. Plus I can use my hydration bladder for bike rides or long runs.
customer_reviews.author: Joe M

customer_reviews.title: Moldy Smell
customer_reviews.text: Good day, This is my second negative review on amazon after years of being a customer (two in one day, a record!). This backpack came in a clear plastic package with moisture trapped inside of it, making the backpack itself smell moldy as heck. I'm currently drying it outside in the sunlight, but if the smell persists after that, and an additional wash and dry, I'm sending it back. Very frustrated, I wish it wasn't stinky and wet when I got it. 1/10. Respectfully, Tony
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Even Get a Single Use Out of It
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work. I purchased the vest with the 2L bladder. The mouthpiece attached to the end of the straw had no suction. Couldn't get a drop of water out of it. I returned it for a refund. I'm training for my first half-marathon this fall, and am now back to searching for a belt or vest to carry larger quantities of water with me on my training runs. I'm extremely disappointed, because this product seemed like the perfect solution. Save your money and look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Rach Kay

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product at an excellent price!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I have been looking for a hydration pack that has pockets in the front chest- finally have the one without breaking the bank. This highly visible pack allows me to cycle with ease. I’ve hooked up a water bladder and bikes over 50 miles. This pack has convenient bottle holders up front, which are also big enough to allow for a granola bar and phone, per respective pocket. The price didn’t break the bank, and is rather roomy for its compact design. My hope is that it holds up for years to come! Excellent purchase. 👌🏼
customer_reviews.author: Kath

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: It is great. It is durable and does its job. It isn’t a main stream trendy brand but you can buy four of these for the price of a name brand pack. Are you really going to go through four of these? Buy it. You won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.author: John R Niven

customer_reviews.title: Great vest!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an alternative to the running belt I have been using. I wanted something that could hold my iphone 8+, water, and not be too bulky. I Just ran a 1/2 Marathon with it this last weekend and couldn't be happier. I used my Camelbak 2L bladder and it fit in the vest like it was made for it... and best of all - it was secure with no movement.
customer_reviews.author: John Snell

customer_reviews.title: Does not come with litre bag but you can find one on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I bought this vest for when I ride my motorcycle. It works perfectly. Be forewarned it does not come with the litre bag. It come with 2 small bottles for the front pocket which I will not use but come in handy to freeze for cooling.
customer_reviews.author: Sally McMullen Mudge

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: It is my first time using a Hydration pack and can't think of something that I didn't like. served me well, used it only once for an Ultramarathon (50 kilometres) and will use it again now that summer is here. if you don't buy the water bottles it isn't a problem as it fits the normal bottles nicely
customer_reviews.author: Esraa

customer_reviews.title: Good for price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great running best for the price. My husband loves it. Mine has a few more features but I also this is a great running best for the price. My husband loved it. Mine has a few more features that I also paid more for it. I recommend getting along without the water bottles and just using a 1 L hydration pack.
customer_reviews.author: Technogen

customer_reviews.title: This is such a great hydration vest for running
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great hydration vest for running. It is very light and made of great materials that dry quickly. There is enough space for a phone and gels in the pockets. It is easily adjustable and does not chafe during a long run. What more could you ask for? I took it on a 9 mile test run on a local trail and it was perfect. There is enough room in the back for a large water bottle or a small hydration reservoir (1 liter). I brought a 750 ml water bottle in the back and it didn't move around and felt comfortable during the run. Highly recommended product!
customer_reviews.author: Ben M.

customer_reviews.title: High utility and comfortable for long distances.
customer_reviews.text: Great pack, lots of pockets and ergonomic for long runs - no hot spot or issues with fit. Couple good spots for goodies, and the bottles are pretty easy to access and secure on the move. Did a marathon and it was the moneymaker compared to just having a bladder...
customer_reviews.author: Jay T

customer_reviews.title: Love the vest!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Why would you pay for an expensive vest when this one is fantastic!!! I mean, I love it and now have used it Trail running for a few months. I have a big cell phone too and it sits in back pocket and doesn’t bounce when running, I truly love this vest. One of my best purchases in a while!!!
customer_reviews.author: Boat

customer_reviews.title: Not keep water cool in hot water
customer_reviews.text: I have a Nathan pack and it keeps my water cool for 3+ hours. This pack is thin and the ice melts and water turns warm in 30-60 minutes. Needs extra padding. Also why not put a zip pocket on the back - it is a waste of space that could be used to store headlamp etc. I would pay extra for that!
customer_reviews.author: Randy l

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Hydration Pack
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I use it for running longer distances and hiking. It’s so easy to adjust the straps on the fly without taking it off, which makes it much more usable to me. Has enough extra space in the backpack to hold some food and the front pouches are so convenient. Glad I bought it and will get another if I ever need one.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Bladder was missing a piece.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this pack, however, there is a missing piece on the bladder so I can’t use that☹️. I’m very disappointed so I took away one star, but I like the fit and other features of the vest so far 😊.
customer_reviews.author: Heather O.

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful for my running
customer_reviews.text: I can now place my keys and phone in the backpack! It is light and won't be an extra weight for your running. The only problem is the bottle pockets are tight, maybe only suitable for its own products, I want to use my own bottle to reduce multiple buying or waste, but hard to put it in.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Great!  And good for smaller people too.  :)
customer_reviews.text: Great price for an amazing hydration pack! I was concerned about bouncing, and it doesn’t at all. I’m small, too. 5’2” and 113 lbs. and I was able to cinch it small enough. I LOVE that I have room for my iPhone 8, some tissues, chapstick, and small pepper spray. The only issue is I haven’t been able to get the plastic taste out of the bladder.
customer_reviews.author: schet

customer_reviews.title: Misfire
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product to compete in my 1st Spartan Ultra which is a 30+ Mile trail race in the humid jungle of Hawaii with 70 obstacles. This race take approximately 12 Hours to complete. This hydration pack was crucial for my race strategy as aid stations were far & few between. The night before this big race, I filled my pack with water and attached the drinking line. To my dismay, when attaching the line to the water bladder, it leaked water. I was unable to use it for the race and unfortunately did not finish race due to dehydration.
customer_reviews.author: G Castillo

customer_reviews.title: Ultra runner, can recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this for now two months and feel I can give a solid review that this is comfortable and fits me great. 5’5, 125lbs. I use it 5 days a week for long runs. It holds everything I need. I am a woman so not sure if this would fit a man.
customer_reviews.author: Julianne

customer_reviews.title: comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have run over 20 miles with this thing. Added a 2L platypus water reservoir and no.chafing, no problems. Even with just a jog bra underneath! So glad I went with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Sr

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for a marathon!
customer_reviews.text: Just ran a marathon and used this pack - what a great buy! It has excellent easy to access pockets for storing snacks, your ID, phone, etc. and really is lightweight and comfortable. Worked great for the 26.2 miles, plus all of the dozens of other miles in training. I'd highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: CQ82

customer_reviews.title: Solid pack
customer_reviews.text: Great light pack with just enough space for the essentials. I’ve used this for mutliple long distance runs and it doesn’t bounce around like my last one did. I put a hydration bladder in the main compartment and it still holds steady even on rough trail runs. The only negative I would have is it doesn’t come with a hydration bladder, but other than that it is extremely confortable.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary D Scott Moore

customer_reviews.title: perfect for me!!
customer_reviews.text: Great running vest, especially for the price. I ran/hiked the 4 Pass Loop around the Maroon Bells (Colorado) a couple of days ago, and the vest was comfortable and performed well. It held a 1 Liter hydration system, food for the 27 miles, hat, gloves, windbreaker, water purification, a tiny knife, car key, and my Samsung S6 (in a case) with style. My issues with that day had nothing to do with my triwonder pack! The fit was fine, but I am glad I'm not any smaller for it ( 38 jacket), but I also like equipment to not be loose. Hope this helps :)
customer_reviews.author: Marco

customer_reviews.title: Light and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I personally am not a fan of arm bands and hip belts while running, I needed something that would hold water, my phone, and fuel without feeling hindered while running. This vest has been great, It is lightweight with multiple pockets for my phone, bars, and keys. There is also an extra space on the back for a light layer. Function-able, light, and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Someone

customer_reviews.title: Great price/perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Have used this many times for trail running and hiking. Perfect fit for my phone in the one of the water pouches. Fits my large chest and doesn’t bounce around much at all. Above all great price
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Loomis

customer_reviews.title: Best hydration vest for hiking
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of placing two gatorade bottles on each strap, it’s easily accessible and can handle the weight of the bottles. The little bag at the back I used it for storing my selfie gears and some snack.
customer_reviews.author: LaDrone

customer_reviews.title: Great pack for runners
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pack because I was training to run a virtual half marathon at the end of July. I have used it on several shorter (5-10 mime) runs & it is great. The two front pockets are great for my phone & sunglasses. It fits great & does not move or bounce while running.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Breinlinger

customer_reviews.title: Best Hydration Pack I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: The engineering is the best I've seen. This is my fourth brand of hydration packs and hands down the best I've owned. From the easy open / fill top, to the detachable drinking tube, to the comfort this is a great product!
customer_reviews.author: boB Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: This provides everything I need for long runs and doesn't move while I'm wearing it. Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for anything!
customer_reviews.text: This hydration pack is perfect! It’s just what I was looking for when I decided to start training for a half marathon. Lightweight and adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie McPherson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for to use on my trail runs. Plenty of front pockets for your phone, keys, pepper spray or whatever. Rear storage is fine for light jacket or water blatter I'ved it for a couple of months and is holding up very well.
customer_reviews.author: Anna F

customer_reviews.title: Good to Get Started
customer_reviews.text: This is great and affordable. I do love the pockets. I do get occasional chaffing if I am wearing a tank with it, particularly on my shoulder/neck. The tube can be long and hard to manage sometimes where it bounces too much. I use this for my marathon training runs and hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Jim E.

customer_reviews.title: Holds everything I need
customer_reviews.text: I love this so much better than my armband I use to carry. I have a bladder in the back. In the front I carry gu in the top pouches and a taser and cell phone the lower pouches. I even started wearing it short runs because I can get my cell phone in and out much faster.
customer_reviews.author: TheKolanders

customer_reviews.title: It’s exactly  what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only tested this out in my house but I am so excited because it seems to work and fit perfectly . I’ve researched these packs for a while and I’m super happy with this one. No more water sloshing around as I run! Also I thought the color would be too vibrant but it’s totally ok and I kind of like that it’s bright.
customer_reviews.author: Gracey

customer_reviews.title: Great for long runs
customer_reviews.text: This pack worked great for my first half marathon. It fit good and didn’t bounce. It was a bit heavy with the bladder filled up, but after I started taking drinks from it the weight went down. The bladder it’s self seems a bit flimsy and could get a hole easily, but as long as your careful with it it should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Overall really good
customer_reviews.text: Good overall. I’m a little broad around the chest but not the biggest. So I have it stretched out to maximum. Any bigger and it wouldn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Roustabout7

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: love this thing. Perfect pockets for phone. Perfect amount of storage. Stays put and no annoying bouncing around or chafing. Very comfortable. My son ordered an identical one. Great for being outside and keeping hands free
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Great running vest
customer_reviews.text: This vest rules. Needed a running vest for my half and I didn’t want to spend $100 on a vest. I prefer the water bottles than the bladder but both work.
customer_reviews.author: SChesin

customer_reviews.title: Leak in water reservoir
customer_reviews.text: I open the package upon arrival, the vest seemed both durable and comfortable. I filled the water reservoir and it began to leak from where the hose attaches. I followed the instructions and attached it correctly. The water would leak until near empty in 20 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: John Monaco

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Works great used for tough mudder was great but lost one bottle for the pouch but no biggie
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable for long runs!
customer_reviews.text: I used this for running my first half and LOVED it. I will be purchasing a bladder separate for my full marathon. I was able to store things in the front and back pocket since I only used the water bottles in the front. When using the bladder, the pockets that you would normally put the water bottles in works perfectly for your phone. Super comfortable, didn’t bounce around and I would recommend this to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Water jug broke easily
customer_reviews.text: The small water jug that comes with it easily broke after my marathon. Cheap material. The bag was okay.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable fit is nice. Enough pockets to fit just about everything I ...
customer_reviews.text: Adjustable fit is nice. Enough pockets to fit just about everything I need on a long run. Easy to put on and take off (doesn't snag on my elbows going on or off). Has done about 300 miles with me this year, and the only thing is I wish I had spent the extra for the handheld water bottles.
customer_reviews.author: HarkJohnny

customer_reviews.title: Super light, and so many pockets
customer_reviews.text: First hydration vest and I don’t think I need another one! Super light, and so many pockets. Took it on a 15 mile run last weekend and it was perfect. I had to get a longer bottom strap due to the fact I have a larger chest, but other than that extremely light! Bought 2 more water bottles, so I can’t wait to run my ultras with this!
customer_reviews.author: aford1184

customer_reviews.title: Great starter backpack
customer_reviews.text: Loveeeee this pack! The only thing I don’t like about it? No instructions anywhere! So I figured it out obviously but it would be nice if it came with SOMETHING. It’s comfortable, doesn’t bounce and lots of room for your stuff. Highly recommend for the price.
customer_reviews.author: ARC

customer_reviews.title: I like the size of the vest and it fits quite ...
customer_reviews.text: I like the size of the vest and it fits quite well (doesn't bounce around) but the torso strap broke/fell apart on the second run. However, the company immediately replaced it and I haven't had any problems with the new one.
customer_reviews.author: Monica K. Henry

customer_reviews.title: All in one
customer_reviews.text: Excellent backpack for people who loves running in forest and explore new routes. Very light and have all you need in a long run.
customer_reviews.author: Hector Raul Cardona

product_meta.title: TRIWONDER Hydration Pack Backpack 5.5L Outdoors Mochilas Trail Marathoner Running Race Hydration Vest
feature_bullets: 💡 Seller Warranty - We offer 18 Months Warranty. Please feel free to contact us if the product has any quality issues.
💡 As all our products are fulfilled by Amazon, if you have any questions about shipment, exchange or returns, please contact Amazon Customer Service directly.
✅ THIS VERSION IS HYDRATION VEST ONLY, NOT INCLUDED WATER BLADDER OR WATER BOTTLES

✅ BREATHABLE + ADJUSTABLE -- Soft and lightweight mesh on back and shoulder straps maximize breathability. The race vest with slide-adjustable sternum straps enhance fit and reduces bounce while running

✅ LIGHTWEIGHT -- The hydration pack with shorter length delivers a close, comfortable and chafe-free fit. Reflectivity on the front and back enhance your visibility. Ultra running vest provides you with the max support and min burden

✅ SUPER POCKET -- You can carry everything you need with the water backpack. Super pocket design that your water bottles, phone, keys, foods can easily stored in the front pack pockets, and bladder or other items can be held in the back one

✅ EXTENSIVE APPLICATIONS -- Our waterproof and sturdy running water vest aims to accompany your trip of Running, Marathon, Jogging, Hiking, Climbing, Cycling, Walking, Backpacking, etc. TRIWONDER 5.5L hydration backpack for men, women and kids

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
